intro: Melampyrum lineare subsp. typicum, commonly known as yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly referred to as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
